title: Leave no trash behind
description: Always take your trash with you or dispose of it properly. Food scraps, packaging and cigarettes can harm local fauna and flora.

title: Respect wildlife
description: Do not feed wild animals, keep a safe distance and do not disturb their natural habitats. This preserves natural behavior.

title: Stay on marked trails
description: Always follow official trails to prevent soil erosion and vegetation damage. Do not create shortcuts or new paths.

title: Save water
description: Use water consciously, especially in scarce regions. Don't waste it in taps, showers or pools.

title: Don't remove plants or rocks
description: Leave everything as you found it. Plants, rocks, flowers and other natural elements belong to the ecosystem.

title: Respect historical heritage
description: Do not touch, scratch or damage monuments, statues, historical plaques or old buildings. They belong to everyone.

title: Value local culture
description: Learn and respect local traditions, buy from local artisans and appreciate regional cuisine.

title: Photograph consciously
description: When photographing local people, always ask permission. Respect sacred places where photos may be prohibited.

title: Support local businesses
description: Prefer local establishments, local guides and handmade products. This strengthens the community economy.

title: Be respectful with residents
description: Treat local residents with respect and kindness. You are a visitor in their home.

title: Respect visiting hours
description: Follow established visiting hours and avoid excessive noise, especially in residential areas.

title: Get informed before visiting
description: Research specific site rules, entrance fees, the best season and required equipment.

title: Travel in small groups
description: Smaller groups cause less environmental impact and allow for a more authentic experience.

title: Use biodegradable products
description: Prefer biodegradable sunscreen, repellent and hygiene products to avoid contaminating rivers and soil.

title: Educate other visitors
description: Share preservation knowledge with other tourists. Be a positive example of conscious travel.
